alert.note: Alert for Sheridan Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 06 at 3:03AM MST until January 07 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Billings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow today and bitterly cold wind chills this morning. Snow amounts will be from 2 to 5 inches. * WHERE...South central Montana, as well as the Sheridan Foothills in Wyoming. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Snow will develop over the west this morning and move east through the day, before tapering off tonight. Snow will affect the morning and evening commutes, so be prepared for slick and snow packed roads, along with poor visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This morning will be very cold with wind chills of 20 to 35 below zero. Wind chills this cold can cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, call 5 1 1. Additional graphics for this hazard can be found at http://www.weather.gov/billings
